website_summaries.verdict: This inexpensive spading fork is one worth considering if you're on a budget and have a moderate amount of work to do.
pros: The shaft length comfortably fits those over 5 feet 10 inches
Works well for applying mulch, spreading compost, and mucking horse stalls
It's light weight reduces fatigue during long-term use
cons: Because the shaft is made of wood, if too much pressure is applied it can break

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product! After only a few lightweight uses it snapped in half. VERY dangerous. Users be ware! I'm 48, female turning over a small amount of soil, not like I was over exerting.
customer_reviews.author: sassy

customer_reviews.title: an accident waiting to happen
customer_reviews.text: Have never brought a pitchfork that broke. I am a baby boomer, meaning older, and the first time I used this it broke in half. I mention the age because I am not exactly strong. If it broke in half if I used it, I can only imagine if someone stronger used it and the bottom went flying and hurt someone. This could definitely cause major damage, the manufacturer should definitely up their liability coverage, and I strongly suggest no one purchase this item.
customer_reviews.author: MaddyO

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: As reported by others, this snapped after minimal force being applied to it. As the picture shows, this was not a heavily used item. I do not believe fit for purpose and how can this be an Amazon recommended? Amazon, please read your reviews.
customer_reviews.author: DDL

customer_reviews.title: Pure GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: The old saying that a cheap tool is an expensive tool is perfectly illustrated by this piece of junk. If you want to use it for tossing dried grass or other weightless stuff, it might work. Just don't try using it in the ground, even loose and soft ground, because it snaps like a twig. I've been gardening for 20 plus years, this is the worst tool I've ever seen. I'm 5'6;" and weigh 130, so not like I'm the Terminator. Save your money, this is trash.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Gee

customer_reviews.title: Broken handle within 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to aerate my 4x4x4 foot compost pile. I'll be fair and start with the good... the fork itself is well made and so is the metal collar near the fork itself. But, the cheap plastic handle snapped after a few months of very light work. It was fastened by only 2 small weak nails! If I had tortured this tool I would have given it the benefit of the doubt. But I was barely putting any load on this thing when it fell apart. I would NOT recommend you buy this tool. Not even for very light work.
customer_reviews.author: Carey Lefebvre

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this. I'm paving my driveway with coarse mulch. Shovels won't go in, raking takes forever and ever and ever. Borrowed one of these off a neighbor, worked like magic and I had to have one of my own. Went with True Temper because that's been a reliable brand for many years. This is a very heavy duty fork. Handle is the perfect length for me, I'm like 5'11". Shorter people might prefer a bit less handle length. If you're moving mulch, you need this. Cannot recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Bippert

customer_reviews.title: It has too much give for my liking and feels like it could snap whenever I applied a moderate amount ...
customer_reviews.text: With limited use, it is as expected. My only concern is the yellow plastic handle at the top. It has too much give for my liking and feels like it could snap whenever I applied a moderate amount of pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Musei1128

customer_reviews.title: Great product, good price.
customer_reviews.text: Back in business again. Have used these too much over the years and yet when needed there is nothing else like them. Manure, garden soil, most anything but rocks or clay you can't beat this fork. Strong enough for heavy duty work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: small , flat tines not what i hoped for and not that durable feeling.
customer_reviews.text: not as good as i hoped. the tines are too flat, and far too small to be a truly useful tool. I know my hand tools, i grew up using these things all the time, and this is not a nice tool. I would add that i would be afraid to "lean into" this tool, it is not super solid feeling. A complete waste of money for me as i actually use these tools i dont just stack them in a shed.
customer_reviews.author: MR Cart

customer_reviews.title: It's a pitchfork, and it does pitchforky things - what more could you want?
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to complain about so far. Does what it's supposed to do. Four stars = "I like it" - I'm not sure what it would take to make me "love" a pitchfork, but five stars = "I love it" - so I guess I'll give it four. There was one little spot of the plastic handle where it was molded that had a slight imperfection - maybe that's why it's four stars (doesn't really affect the use of the fork for what I'd bought it for, which is turning compost, which it does very well).
customer_reviews.author: Tony M

customer_reviews.title: Solid pitch fork
customer_reviews.text: Use it for turning my compost pile, and working my garden. Strong and solid... and pitchy because.... it’s a pitch fork. Shipping was slow.... slow..... but good product.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Campfield

customer_reviews.title: Why oh why didn't I get this years ago?
customer_reviews.text: Oh HOW I love this fork! PERFECT for moving mulch. PERFECT for lifting daylilies and irises. PERFECT for loosening soil for whatever reason. Heavy enough to be up to any task, but light enough for me - a 66 year old woman. Just PERFECT.
customer_reviews.author: Patience C. Renzulli

customer_reviews.title: Picture shows synthetic looking handle, recieved wood.
customer_reviews.text: Its a good turning fork for light duty gardening in your backyard, I was under the impression (by the looks of the photos online) that this would have a synthetic handle for the price, turns out it's wood when it arrives on your doorstep semi-wrapped in cellophane with a big shipping sticker stuck on the wooden handle. yay!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke Too Soon
customer_reviews.text: I used this fork the day it arrived and was soooo excited to finally have found just what I needed for my compost area. Six months later, the handle broke off at the cuff. I am so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sharron Bickham

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for a while but unfortunately after <10 months of infrequent use the head separated from the shaft. Unclear through the ap if it can be returned but this does not meet my expectations for reasonable wear on a garden tool and if I had brought from a regular store I’m certain I could have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Barefootrow

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: The 30" fork is not well made. It says Made in USA but on the box says distributed by with an American name. The parts came from China and it is assembled in the USA, so the information is false.
customer_reviews.author: Doobie Do

customer_reviews.title: Makes stirring a compost bin easy.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to stir my compost bin. Does a great job, surpasses any shovel.
customer_reviews.author: gardenanimals

customer_reviews.title: Made in china
customer_reviews.text: Description states that is made in the usa. But it is not. It's made in china. If description is misleading then product is weak and fragile.
customer_reviews.author: The WB's

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pitchfork to dig for bait in the sand at the beach. I was skeptical of the price at first, a similar pitchfork was a good $50+ at my local hardware store. Very happy with this, its rock solid, not sure how other people are breaking this thing. Used it many times and the salt hasn't eaten away at it yet. I'd order another!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha L.

customer_reviews.title: Not Trash
customer_reviews.text: I've had this digging for for awhile and I still prefer my old fork with a wider head for mulch even though its broken under the steel collar. However this fork perform better at digging because the head is smaller and I'm less likely to use to much force on it.
customer_reviews.author: ER

customer_reviews.title: Bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: Love the sturdiness, shorter handle and easy to use size. Also, the blades (forks) are triangular and work well in my soil.
customer_reviews.author: Bluefish

customer_reviews.title: Good fork
customer_reviews.text: Good short fork, great for my composte pile. Well made and solid.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old digging fork that finally broke after using it for over 15 years. This one seems to be just as well made, if not better. I like that the tines are sturdy enough to break up the hard soil in my planter bed without having to jump on it like I have to do with a regular shovel. Very happy with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon B

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once so I'm hesitant to give it any 5-stars. It appears to be well made but I was terribly disappointed and surprised at its size. It's small. For those who use this type of tool it's not a pitchfork, as I had expected. If a category were offered for size I'd give it a one..........
customer_reviews.author: Philip Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool. I used it this spring for what ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool. I used it this spring for what seemed like dozens of jobs around the yard, from turning my mulch pile, to spreading compost, and even creating holes for seed planting. Has held up with no signs of wear so far. It is lightweight for it's level of durability and the flat shoulders are perfect for when I need extra foot power.
customer_reviews.author: Charlyn Wherry

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Nice, heavy duty fork. We moved and my spade fork was left behind. I couldn't find one in any of the local stores. Happy to have found this on Amazon. My only regret is that it has a plastic handle and it has an angled handle. I would have preferred it to be straight. The person that designed this obviously never used a spade fork.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tough and Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Man, this thing can really poke. If that’s what you’re looking for, this is perfect. It’s heavy and seems pretty well built. I haven’t actually used mine yet, I just bought it in case I need one some day.
customer_reviews.author: Derek B

customer_reviews.title: the handle is weak
customer_reviews.text: Each time I use this, I hear the handle "creak and crack". Am expecting the handle to break when I use it. It is used quite infrequently by an 83 year old man with rheumatoid arthritis so it is not strained.
customer_reviews.author: James  B Slaughter

customer_reviews.title: Good and sturdy tool at a fair price.
customer_reviews.text: My husband says that the tool is a good fit for a person of his size. A quality product well worth the price. Since its arrival, he has used it daily in his vegetable garden. Many similar products are too short-handled for a tall person.
customer_reviews.author: Meeker mouse

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy Garden fork
customer_reviews.text: No complaints so far. This is a great addition to my garden tools. I need sturdy tools to work in our hard Virginia red clay soil; this fork gets the job done nicely. I’m impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn H

customer_reviews.title: WASTE
customer_reviews.text: This broke easily and barely used....save your money and go elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy but well made
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pitchfork because it’s not too heavy but performs well. Perfect size for smaller jobs like spearing prickly pear which is what I’ve been using it for!
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: Flat and straight
customer_reviews.text: Not angled enough for removing asphalt shingles from a roof. Best used for digging in a garden or removing yard waste from your trailer at the compost site
customer_reviews.author: The King

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to use! I love the handle as well. It did a great job for what I used it for. I highly recommend this brand!
customer_reviews.author: L. M. S

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool but fragile
customer_reviews.text: The concept is good but this tool is too weak. It broke after 3 uses. It was my new favorite tool, I will have to buy a new one that is of better quality.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Well Made!
customer_reviews.text: This spading fork has been just great. It's well made and does everything I need it to do. Great for arrorating grass roots and for turning soil. Worth the money! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Osborn

customer_reviews.title: sturdy/well made
customer_reviews.text: a little heavy, but very sturdy, and good for hoeing up stubborn weeds or sculpting out a planting hole for shrubs, etc. Should last for years if taken care of. Sharp, too.
customer_reviews.author: L. Shook

customer_reviews.title: It's sturdy but lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: The kids are going to love this when they go out to the barn on Christmas morning. I can just hear them tussling over who gets to use it first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy Dandy!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very timely, boxed well..no wasted space/packing. Been using for a few months now and i love it. Use it for compost turning and digging up stuff in the garden. Nice height/weight when I'm at it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Savory Sander

customer_reviews.title: Great garden tool
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how fast this came! Best bargain I found and an awesome tool for gardeners.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As described.  Works good.
customer_reviews.text: Very robust and strong fork. Have moved a lot of hard clay with it and it keeps going. No issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: Silverfoot

customer_reviews.title: but it feels tough and it worked like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I used this fork today to help loosen the soil so I could pull up weeds. The fork isn't heavy, but it feels tough and it worked like a dream. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: broke after 6 month
customer_reviews.text: bought in June 2019 ,broke in December 2019 and I barely used it.
customer_reviews.author: mantel gael

customer_reviews.title: It broke on me
customer_reviews.text: It seemed like a good tool, but it broke on the 2nd day. I was digging up flower bulbs and the metal fork broke off.
customer_reviews.author: Zang

customer_reviews.title: Better than a Shovel
customer_reviews.text: Easier and fast digging than with a shovel and makes turning the garden much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Grand papa

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, well made, easy to use. Exactly what I need to replace the fork shovel I broke.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Blumberg

customer_reviews.title: Great birthday gift for son in law.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift . It feels very sturdy and seems well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry G Olson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy for compost tilling.\
customer_reviews.text: Used for our compost. I'm leaving it outside in the weather (about 1 month so far) so that we can turn our compost whenever we dump a new pail. I will update this if the Fork shows any signs of improper wear.
customer_reviews.author: NYCBrindledog

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and does the job. Bit smaller than a standard pitch fork you might imagine.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Too Tall
customer_reviews.text: Great tool but very tall. Had to return. Unless you are over 6’ this tool will be hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Used for first time
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a just in case. Finally had chance to use. Very sturdy. Moved through soil like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzmom

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: The garden fork is just the right size for digging and turning over the soil.Nice well balanced and strong construction.
customer_reviews.author: dennis  d.

customer_reviews.title: Ok spading fork but plastic handle with hole drilled on bottom and not even smoothed out. Quality control issue.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as replacement that finally gave out. One thing I do not like is the plastic handle. For some reason a small hole was drilled right smack in the middle of handle on bottom. I can only think hole is to drain water from hanle if left out. The problem with hole drilled is "drill barbs" were not rubbed out. No huge deal but quality control is not what I expect.
customer_reviews.author: PtH

customer_reviews.title: Broken on first use
customer_reviews.text: This item broke immediately under very little pressure. One of the tines broke off in moderately compacted backyard soil. Really disappointed in this purchase for turning an old flower bed and our compost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and compact
customer_reviews.text: Good size for a woman to handle. Very sturdy and compact.
customer_reviews.author: anniegiturgun

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I quickly broke the first one I received. Swapped it for a new one that works great.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough to handle everyday dirt
customer_reviews.text: looks cheap, and afraid it will break with little force! I wish I had read reviews . I own several Ames brand tools, and they have proven to be of a great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Arsene Lupin

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely made and hold up well
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid piece of garden equipment. Well priced and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kathi

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bent after a few uses. Was fairly firm clay, but still did not expect to bend so quickly
customer_reviews.author: doof

customer_reviews.title: Better than you anticipated!
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line it was a surprise for my wife. Let’s just say it was more than gold for me.
customer_reviews.author: Charlo V.

customer_reviews.title: High quality pitch fork
customer_reviews.text: Very affordable & durable pitch fork. I'm using to flip compost pile.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Not a quality product.
customer_reviews.text: One tine Bent badly on first use then handle cracked on next use.
customer_reviews.author: Dane Collins

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect size for my needs. I was really impressed with the sturdiness of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Shook

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for woodchips!
customer_reviews.text: Great pitchfork! Got it as a gift for Christmas and have used it many times since. Perfect for woodchips!
customer_reviews.author: C. Dian

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I need for a pitch fork. Sturdy and reliable
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Go-to garden tool
customer_reviews.text: Love this fork digging tool. I've put it to the test for over a year in heavy, rocky clay and it's a must have tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product but heavy if you don’t like lifting heavy items
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality tool for use in daily gardening tasks.
customer_reviews.text: A great garden spade. Needed a taller handle with a rigid set of times. This fit exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: peter souza

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty. Well made, but not too heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty. Well made, but not too heavy for a woman to use and carry around...I have a shovel that is so heavy, I don't use it.
customer_reviews.author: clroyal220

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have been digging up a rocky lawn with a pitchfork first and ended up with the tines bent every which way. Now I am using the digging fork which is slightly heavier but shows no signs of bending even when hitting rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Bavarica

customer_reviews.title: exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I am not trying to use this on the farm but for home garden use this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Ford

customer_reviews.title: It’s new. It works.
customer_reviews.text: Works. So far so good. Replacing one that broke. Best value I could find.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A.

customer_reviews.title: it is exactly what i needed very strong i made ...
customer_reviews.text: it is exactly what i needed very strong i made a mistake and bought a "fibreglass" handled one, and it broke the first time i tried to dig up a plant with it.
customer_reviews.author: slowjohn

customer_reviews.title: Well made and does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and strongly made to handle the weight of tossing/turning. Bought ours for a small home garden and compost needs.
customer_reviews.author: CO Boy

customer_reviews.title: Quality but small
customer_reviews.text: It’s pretty small. I’m sure the dimensions are accurate but it’s definitely not “full size”.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Moenkhaus

customer_reviews.title: well-made fork
customer_reviews.text: looked at quite a few before selecting this one. good choice
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: well made very strong but gets gummed up when using to rotate compost because of larger tines
customer_reviews.author: dustin

customer_reviews.title: sturdy enough to move a ton of wood chips
customer_reviews.text: Light enough to carry in an angry mob, sturdy enough to move a ton of wood chips.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M

customer_reviews.title: great fork
customer_reviews.text: Came the next day like they said it would and worked like a charm. I would refer this to friends
customer_reviews.author: Vonda Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Great spading fork
customer_reviews.text: Use it to turn our compost pile, very weather resistant. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: David T

customer_reviews.title: I really like the weight (light) of this spade
customer_reviews.text: I really like the weight (light) of this spade. I had to mix up about 20 cubic feet worth of raised beds and the grip/size of this was great. The packaging seemed a little much...a 6' box with just this in it. But the tines are sharp so i guess it's warranted.
customer_reviews.author: Bec Powell

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and shoddy construction.
customer_reviews.text: The base is misaligned to the shaft and handle. Poorly constructed, and makes using it difficult.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: I liked using it to till my garden until I purchased a small cultivator.
customer_reviews.author: freelife44

customer_reviews.title: Versatile tool
customer_reviews.text: Good all around fork. It was smaller than expected but turns out to be good for weeding too.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Burke

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Much easier to spread mulch or turn a compost pile compared to using a shovel
customer_reviews.author: Rajeev M.

customer_reviews.title: nice and stout fork
customer_reviews.text: pretty strong fork holds up well. roling back 50 year old ivy with giant roots. works nice to turn the compacted yard.
customer_reviews.author: J.bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Cute with a purpsose
customer_reviews.text: My wife uses this for turning compost. It's light enough for her to use and she likes the color, she can always find it. It's made to last, a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Gene C

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. Only used it a couple of times. But definitely better than the one I had earlier. Going to use it for moving plants. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: anita

customer_reviews.title: Great for turning soil
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! Great for turning soil. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: enc

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was shipped super fast and is just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: rosemarie j schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small garden/compost bin
customer_reviews.text: Great grip and sturdy. I use it for our compost bin and our garden that is about 3 ft x 10 ft.
customer_reviews.author: Abby McFall

customer_reviews.title: Fork to flowers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pitch fork for digging up flower bulbs and tubers. It's the perfect size and the tinges are very sturdy. It is my go to tool now.
customer_reviews.author: Neeks

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is the rust, but you take what you can get.
customer_reviews.author: JSwoll

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for turning my compost piles. Feels well made too.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Works well in heavy soil
customer_reviews.text: I needed to break up a patch of lawn in heavy black clay soil. This fork really did the trick. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Diane J. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few months now and it's still fantastic, I use it to churn my compost and no rust or anything so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ava

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect product fpor what I needed it for. Nicer than I thought it would be
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Dug up potatoes in hard clay soil no problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent product. very sturdy. i use mine to turn my compost pile and it's perfect for that.
customer_reviews.author: patricia felegy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to with no frill and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Orange Crush

product_meta.title: True Temper 2812200 4-Tine Spading Digging Fork with 30 in. Hardwood D-Grip Handle, 30 Inch
product_meta.description: Size:30 InchThe True Temper 2812200 Forged Spading Fork is one of the most versatile tools you can own. It is designed for digging, turning and aerating soil in beds and gardens. Its 4 forged diamond-point steel tine break up even the toughest soil and clay. This fork also features a 30 in. hardwood handle and comfortable D-grip.
feature_bullets: 4 diamond pointed steel tines for easy soil penetration
30-inch hardwood handle for strength and durability
Poly D-Grip for added leverage and control

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars383 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
